general_advisory: Kharif crop 2024: Only maintain 3-5 cm water in the field up to flowering stage in paddy. Provide drainage facility to drain out excess water. Due to high humidity, survey for any insect pest in kharif crops and take action as suggested.

advisory: Due to forecast of heavy rain, postpone application of fertilizer and chemicals.
To manage Pod borer in green gram and black gram crop, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80-gram/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5 % SC @ 80-ml/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400-ml/acre.
Condition is favorable for blast incidence in ragi, if observed spray Tricyclazole 75% WP @ 1 g/litre of water when the sky becomes clear.
Go for the thinning operation and maintain the optimum plant population.
Due to weather, there are chances of Aphids in Maize, to manage this, apply Dimethoate @ 2 ml/liter of water.
Due to weather, root rot disease is seen, to manage this spray Carbendazim @ 2 g/liter of water.
Rhizome rot may be seen, then apply Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets and Neem oil @ 75 ml/15 liter of water as curative measures.
To control wilt, spray Tebuconazole 25.9% EC @ 200-ml/acre + Streptocycline @ 30g/acre at the root zone mixed with 200 liters of water.

Select suitable varieties like Utkal Kumari (BT-10), Utkal Deepti (BT-2), Utkal Raja, Utkal Pragyan and Swarna Sampad for raising in the nursery. 150 to 200 grams of seed are required for planting in one acre area.
To manage fruit borer, spray Cyntraniliprole 10.26% OD @ 240 ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water.
There are chances of infestation of Downy Mildew disease in cucurbit vegetables after the heavy rainfall. To manage Downy Mildew disease in cucurbits, spray Copper Hydroxide 77 % WP @ 3 g/litre.
To manage Sigatoka leaf spot and Cigar end rot or Tip rot, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 3g/liter of water.
To control papaya leaf curl virus, install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos/acre and spray neem oil (1500 ppm) @ 3ml/liter of water.
As grasses are high in moisture content during rainy days, the cattle donâ€™t get adequate dry matter. So, give 1 kg of concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals.
